entry.title: DRIVER FALLS ASLEEP, LEADING TO SINGLE-VEHICLE FREEWAY CRASH

entry.title: Diamond Lake Resort Opens Tubing Hill After 12 Inches of Fresh Snow
entry.summary: Diamond Lake Resort received 12 inches of snow in the past 24 hours, bringing the base to 23 inches at 5,200 feet. The tubing hill opens for night tubing at 6 p.m. tomorrow (01/09), with snowmobile trails also being groomed as winter recreation ramps up.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 1.8.26
entry.summary: Joining us from just off the floor of the U.S. Senate, Senator Jeff Merkley joins us to talk about current issues and the Town Hall meeting in Roseburg on Saturday.

entry.title: Police Log: January 7, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple enforcement contacts tied to prohibited camping and littering near waterways, plus several warrant arrests. Incidents also included a domestic menacing case follow-up, a driving-while-suspended arrest, and a non-injury crash.

entry.title: Jon Martz is Oregon's high school principal of 2026
entry.summary: Sutherlin High School Principal Jon Martz said he was completely unaware of his nomination to be the 2026 Oregon High School Principal of the Year, as the process is completely anonymous.

entry.title: OREGON’S UNEMPLOYMENT RATE WAS 5.2 PERCENT IN NOVEMBER
entry.summary: January 8, 2026 3:40 a.m. On Wednesday, the Oregon Employment Department released monthly employment and unemployment data for November 2025, after a significant delay due to the federal government shutdown. An OED release said the state’s unemployment rate was 5.2 percent in November and 5.2 percent in September. The Oregon unemployment rate is not available...

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested Following Burglary at Vacant SE Pine Street Home
entry.summary: A Roseburg man was arrested after police responded to a reported burglary at a vacant SE Pine Street home. Officers found extensive interior damage exceeding $1,000. The suspect was later located nearby and faces burglary and criminal mischief charges.

entry.summary: YMCA of Douglas County CEO Steven Stanfield talks about getting fit in the new year, and how the YMCA can help.

entry.title: Road to hot springs closed due to incoming storm
entry.summary: TOKETEE — The United States Department of Agriculture Forest Service announced the closure National Forest System Road (NFSR) 3401 — also known as the road to the Umpqua Hot Springs — on Tuesday.

entry.title: Portland Man Arrested in Roseburg After Stolen Vehicle Stop
entry.summary: A stolen vehicle stop in Roseburg on Jan. 6 led to the arrest of a Portland man after police reportedly found methamphetamine, multiple fictitious IDs, and equipment used to make false identification. Officers also discovered an outstanding probation violation warrant.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 1.7.26
entry.summary: State Representative Court Boice looks back at 2025 in the Oregon State Legislature and looks ahead to the agenda for 2026, but talks about the recent signature gathering effort to force a vote on the Oregon Department of Transportation funding package.

entry.title: Police Log: January 6
entry.summary: Roseburg Police handled multiple incidents Jan. 6, including arrests on outstanding warrants, a stolen vehicle recovery involving meth and false ID charges, burglary and trespass cases, and a harassment citation. Several individuals were cited and lodged at corrections.

entry.title: Center for Dialogue and Resolution expands into Douglas County
entry.summary: Arguments happen, and sometimes in life, even the most petty and trivial ones can make their way to a courtroom. However, one resource in Douglas County is working to make sure it doesn't have to end this way.

entry.title: Mercy Medical Center among Oregon hospitals anticipating upcoming strains
entry.summary: Upcoming federal and state legislation is causing possible struggles for hospitals across Oregon, and Roseburg's Mercy Medical Center is among those preparing for possible issues in the near — and far — future.

entry.title: Road to Umpqua Hot Springs Closed Due to Winter Storm
entry.summary: Starting Jan. 6, 2026, NFSR 3401, the road to Umpqua Hot Springs, will close due to a winter storm. Vehicles must park at the gate. Visitors must hike, snowshoe, or ski the final 2.5 miles.

entry.title: January Happenings at Wildlife Safari
entry.summary: Wildlife Safari kicks off 2026 with Douglas County Appreciation Days Jan. 18–19, offering free drive-thru admission for county residents. January also includes youth camps, seasonal animal viewing, and new DoorDash menu delivery.

entry.title: FSC CrossFit Announces Closure After More Than a Decade in Roseburg
entry.summary: FSC CrossFit has announced it will close after nearly 12 years in Roseburg, with its final class scheduled for Dec. 19, 2025. Owners Gil and Janelle Brown thanked members and said equipment will be sold beginning Jan. 5.

entry.title: UCC hosts 'Transuranic,' a radioactive photography exhibit
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — At first glance, the scenes presented in Abbey Hepner’s photography seem fairly mundane: A lone sign and barbed wire fence in the middle of a grassy field, or pale corporate buildings sitting on the horizon across a plain.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning Remains in Effect for Southern Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains
entry.summary: A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect for the Southern Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains through Thursday morning. Heavy snow, strong winds, and hazardous travel are expected, with up to 20 inches possible at higher elevations.

entry.title: EUGENE MAN JAILED FOLLOWING TRAFFIC STOP ON SUNDAY
entry.summary: January 5, 2026 10:00 a.m. A Eugene man was jailed following a traffic stop on Sunday afternoon. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said just after 5:00 p.m. a deputy was in the area of the 900 block of Skelley Road near Yoncalla and noticed the 36-year-old pull to the side of the road and...

entry.title: WOODBURN MAN JAILED FOLLOWING FREEWAY TRAFFIC STOP
entry.summary: January 5, 2026 9:40 a.m. A Woodburn man was jailed following a freeway traffic stop on Friday afternoon. An Oregon State Police report said at approximately 12:25 p.m. a trooper received a report of a reckless driver traveling south on Interstate 5 just north of Rice Hill. A sports car was reportedly traveling at over...

entry.title: TRANSIENT JAILED AFTER STOLEN VEHICLE WAS RECOVERED
entry.summary: January 5, 2026 9:30 a.m. A transient was jailed after a stolen vehicle was recovered on Saturday afternoon. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 3:45 p.m. while driving on Interstate Five southbound near the Quines Creek Road/Barton Road exit in the Azalea area, a deputy got behind a sedan and learned that it...

entry.title: ROSEBURG MAN TAKEN TO HOSPITAL FOLLOWING TWO-VEHICLE CRASH
entry.summary: January 5, 2026 9:20 a.m. A Roseburg man was taken to the hospital following a two-vehicle crash on Saturday afternoon. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 4:50 p.m. a driver in the 3000 block of Melrose Road attempted to turn into a business and failed to yield to a second vehicle, was going...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 1.5.26
entry.summary: A look at the upcoming Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby with organizer Cam Lawler and fishing guide Don Myers.

entry.title: Roseburg Elks Lodge to celebrate 129 birthday with a bash
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Elks Lodge #326 will have its 129th birthday bash this weekend.

entry.title: Local partnership to offer pruning workshop
entry.summary: ELKTON — The Oregon State University Extension Service in Douglas County, in partnership with Umpqua Soil & Water Conservation District, are offering a fruit tree pruning workshop Saturday, Jan. 17.

entry.title: Moon Mountain String Band opens 2026 at The Rosebud Theater
entry.summary: The Moon Mountain String Band brought a variety of tones to The Rosebud Theatre on Saturday night, flooding the stage with a banjo, mandolin, fiddle, an acoustic bass, twin guitars and multiple voices.

entry.title: Local hoopers qualify for Elks' District Hoop Shoot
entry.summary: The Roseburg Elks Lodge held the local annual Hoop Shoot on Dec 3, 2025, with children ages 8-13 joining in at the Fremont Middle School gym in Roseburg.
